body:
Thanks for the reply, can you point me where I can found the docs stating that? I tried to find that before I filled the issue but wasn't able to. Thanks!

> On 26 Jan 2016, at 04:22, Keith Randall <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> Yes. Go does not make any promises about padding bytes. They might be 0, they might not. If you care about what those values are, do as you did in the workaround.
> 
> Typically only stack variables will have nonzero padding bytes. Of course with unsafe you can manufacture them anywhere.
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
>
